clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 2, Safety, Tolerability, and Efficacy Study of PD 0360324 in Chronic Pulmonary Sarcoidosis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Randomized, Double Blind, Placebo Controlled, Parallel Group, 20 Week, Safety, Tolerability, and Efficacy Study of PD 0360324 in Adult Subjects With Chronic Pulmonary Sarcoidosis

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The study proposes to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and efficacy of PD 0360324 in subjects with chronic pulmonary sarcoidosis inadequately treated with standard of care therapies.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Basic Science

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in % predicted Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) compared to placebo at Week 16.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in chest X ray global assessment score (5 point Likert Scale)
Change from baseline in FVC (absolute and % predicted) compared to placebo at other time points post baseline except Week 16.
Estimated treatment effect over placebo in FVC averaged over 16 weeks.
Change from baseline in other spirometric parameters at all timepoints post baseline: Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1), % predicted FEV1, ratio of FEV1/FVC.

intervention.description: 100 mg Q2W or 150 mg Q2W via intravenous infusion based on protocol determined dose escalation/de-escalation criteria; 12 weeks Active Therapy;
normal saline Q2W via intravenous infusion for 12 weeks
